Package com.gsm.controller

Class ProductController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gsm.controller.ProductController
  • @Controller
@RequestMapping("/products")
public class ProductController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for handling all user-facing HTTP requests related to the Product management feature.

    This includes displaying product lists and forms, as well as processing form submissions for creating, updating, and deleting products.

    • Method Detail

      • showProductForm

        @GetMapping("/form")
public java.lang.String showProductForm​(@RequestParam(required=false)
                                        java.lang.Long id,
                                        org.springframework.ui.Model model,
                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Displays the product form for both creating a new product and editing an existing one.

        Use Case: Navigated to when the user clicks the "Create New" button or the "Edit" link for an existing product.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the product to edit. This is optional and will be null for creating a new product.
        model - The Spring Model object to pass data to the view.
        request - The HttpServletRequest, used here to retrieve the CSRF token.
        Returns:
        The path to the product form view template.

      • saveProduct

        @PostMapping("/save")
public java.lang.String saveProduct​(@ModelAttribute
                                    ProductDto productDto,
                                    org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Processes the submission of the product form.

        Use Case: This endpoint is called via a POST request when the user clicks "Save" on the product form.

        Parameters:
        productDto - The DTO populated with form data, by Spring's @ModelAttribute data binding.
        redirectAttributes - Used to pass messages (success or error) to the next request after a redirect.
        Returns:
        A redirect string to either the product form (on success) or back to the form (on error).

      • showProductList

        @GetMapping
public java.lang.String showProductList​(@RequestParam(required=false)
                                        java.lang.String keyword,
                                        @RequestParam(required=false)
                                        java.lang.String category,
                                        org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Displays the list of all products, with optional filtering.

        Use Case: This is the main landing page for the product management feature. It's also called when a user performs a search or filters the list.

        Parameters:
        keyword - The search term entered by the user. Optional.
        category - The category name selected by the user for filtering. Optional.
        model - The Spring Model to pass data to the view.
        Returns:
        The path to the product list view template.

      • deleteProducts

        @PostMapping("/delete")
public java.lang.String deleteProducts​(@RequestParam(value="selectedIds",required=false)
                                       java.util.List<java.lang.Long> ids,
                                       org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
        Deletes one or more products based on their IDs.

        Use Case: Called via a POST request when the user selects products from the list and clicks the "Delete" button.

        Parameters:
        ids - A list of product IDs to be deleted, captured from the form submission.
        redirectAttributes - Used to show a success or error message after the operation.
        Returns:
        A redirect string back to the product list page.
